title: Pennsylvania Landlord-Tenant Law Reference
disclaimer: This is informational only and does not constitute legal advice. Consult a licensed attorney for legal guidance.

250.101.title: Short Title
250.101.summary: This act shall be known as the 'Landlord and Tenant Act of 1951'

250.201.title: Rights of Tenant
250.201.summary: Tenant has right to possession for the term of the lease, subject to lease conditions
tenantRights: Right to peaceful possession during lease term
Right to proper notice before eviction
Right to return of security deposit

250.202.title: Rights of Landlord
250.202.summary: Landlord may recover possession for non-payment, lease violation, or end of term
keyPoints: Must follow legal process for eviction
May recover unpaid rent and damages

250.203.title: Notice to Vacate
250.203.summary: Required notice periods for various eviction types

noticePeriods.leaseViolation: 15 days written notice (or as specified in lease)
noticePeriods.holdover: Notice required per lease terms or 30 days for month-to-month

250.204.title: Service of Notice
250.204.summary: Methods for serving notice on tenant
validMethods: Posting on premises AND mailing to tenant

250.206.title: Recovery of Possession
250.206.summary: Landlord must use judicial process to recover possession

250.301.title: Security Deposits
keyPoints: Escrow required in approved financial institution
Must return within 30 days of lease termination
Written itemized list required for any deductions
May not withhold for normal wear and tear

250.511.title: Landlord's Liability for Non-Delivery
250.511.summary: Landlord liability for failing to deliver possession

impliedWarranty.name: Implied Warranty of Habitability
impliedWarranty.summary: Pennsylvania recognizes implied warranty of habitability in residential leases
requirements: Plumbing and heating in working order
tenantRemedies: Withhold rent (after proper notice to landlord)

selfHelpEviction.name: Self-Help Eviction Prohibition
selfHelpEviction.summary: Landlords cannot use self-help methods to remove tenants

retaliatoryEviction.name: Retaliatory Eviction Protection
retaliatoryEviction.citation: Common Law / Jacobs v. Nether Inn, Inc.
retaliatoryEviction.summary: Landlord cannot evict in retaliation for tenant exercising legal rights
protectedActivities: Exercising rights under lease or law
retaliatoryEviction.presumption: Rebuttable presumption of retaliation if eviction within reasonable time after protected activity

noticePeriods.name: Required Notice Periods
noticePeriods.summary: Minimum notice periods required under Pennsylvania law

nonpayment.type: Written notice to pay or vacate
nonpayment.notes: Tenant may cure by paying all rent due within the 10-day period
mustInclude: Date by which payment must be made

leaseViolation.type: Written notice to cure or vacate
leaseViolation.notes: Must specify the nature of the violation

holdover.notes: For month-to-month tenancies; must be full rental period

expiration.type: No notice required for fixed-term lease expiration
expiration.notes: Tenant must vacate at end of lease term unless renewed

magisterialDistrict.name: Magisterial District Court
magisterialDistrict.description: Initial filing location for eviction cases
procedures: No jury trial at this level
Appeal de novo to Common Pleas

commonPleas.name: Court of Common Pleas
commonPleas.description: Appeals court and higher value cases
procedures: Appeal must be filed within 30 days
Must post supersedeas bond to stay eviction

appeals.name: Appeal Rights
appeals.summary: Right to appeal Magisterial District Court judgment
keyPoints: Must file in Common Pleas Court
Supersedeas bond required to stay eviction
Bond typically equals judgment plus costs
De novo hearing in Common Pleas

defenses.description: Landlord failed to provide required 10-day written notice
defenses.howToRaise: File answer alleging insufficient notice; request dismissal

defenses.description: All rent due was paid within the 10-day notice period
defenses.howToRaise: Provide receipts showing payment before deadline

defenses.description: Premises not maintained in habitable condition
defenses.howToRaise: Document conditions; show landlord was notified; may justify rent withholding

defenses.description: Landlord accepted partial payment after notice, waiving right to evict
defenses.howToRaise: Show acceptance of payment after notice was served

defenses.description: Amount claimed includes improper charges (late fees not in lease, normal wear deductions)
defenses.howToRaise: Review lease terms; challenge improper fees

defenses.description: Eviction filed in response to tenant exercising legal rights
defenses.howToRaise: Show timing between protected activity and eviction filing

defenses.description: Landlord failed to return security deposit or provide itemization within 30 days
defenses.howToRaise: May claim double damages for wrongfully withheld deposit

defenses.description: Landlord failed to provide required 15-day written notice
defenses.howToRaise: File answer alleging insufficient notice period

defenses.description: Tenant cured the violation within notice period
defenses.howToRaise: Document compliance; show violation was remedied

defenses.description: Alleged violation did not occur or does not violate lease
defenses.howToRaise: Review lease terms; present evidence disproving violation

defenses.description: Landlord enforces provision against tenant but not others
defenses.howToRaise: Document inconsistent enforcement of lease terms

defenses.description: Landlord breached lease before alleged tenant violation
The lease provision being enforced is unconscionable
defenses.howToRaise: Show provision is unfair or hidden in lease

defenses.description: Landlord failed to provide required 30-day notice to terminate month-to-month
Landlord's actions created a new tenancy period
defenses.howToRaise: Show acceptance of rent after lease end; evidence of renewal agreement

defenses.description: Landlord's conduct led tenant to believe tenancy would continue

statewide.name: Housing Alliance of Pennsylvania
statewide.description: Advocacy and resources for affordable housing

courtSystems.general: Magisterial District Courts handle initial eviction cases
courtSystems.appeals: Court of Common Pleas hears appeals within 30 days

tenantProtectionHighlights: Strong implied warranty of habitability established by case law
30-day return requirement for security deposits with potential double damages
Extensive fair housing protections including age and ancestry
